CONJUGATES: decease (V base) | deceases (V 3rd P) | deceasing (V Pr P) | deceased (V past/PP)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English *deces*, ultimately from Latin *dēcēdere* (to depart, go away, die), formed from *de-* ('away') + *cēdere* ('to yield, go').

MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 已故的；已死的（常用于正式或委婉场合）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The policy became null and void after the insured party was pronounced deceased.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在被保险人被宣布已故后，该保单即告作废。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun (preceded by 'the', referring to a person)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The person who has recently died.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The lawyer read the final will and testament of the deceased to the assembled family.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 律师向聚集的家人宣读了死者的遗嘱。
